message: I'm excited to offer you this incredible opportunity to purchase a unique and valuable product. I believe it's worth considering a price of $1200000.
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900000. I believe that's a fair price considering the market value of similar products.
I understand you're looking to negotiate, but I'm not willing to go as low as $900000. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $1100000, but I'm not budging further.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my target price. I'm willing to go up to $950000. Can you consider that?

I'm still not willing to go as low as $950000. I'm willing to compromise, but I think $1050000 is a more reasonable price for this product. Let's meet in the middle and see if we can reach an agreement.
I understand your concerns, but I'm still not comfortable with $1050000. I'm willing to go up to $980000. Can we meet at that price?

I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal, but I'm still not willing to go as low as $980000. I'm willing to make one more significant concession, and I'll meet you at $1020000. Let's see if we can finalize the deal at this price.
I appreciate your willingness to make a concession, but I'm still a bit above my target price. I'm willing to go up to $990000. Can we meet at that price?

I'm not willing to go as low as $990000. I think we've had a good negotiation, but I'm not willing to give up much more value. I'm willing to meet you at $1050000, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. It's now or never, Bob.

I appreciate your final offer, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to walk away if I don't get a better deal. I'm going to make one last attempt to negotiate. I'll offer $995000. If that's not acceptable, I'll have to consider buying from John.
